summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons administrative document detailing the status of inmate Jeffrey Epstein following a suicide attempt on July 23, 2019. It notes he was found with a homemade rope around his neck and was pending a disciplinary hearing for self-mutilation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found with a homemade rope around his neck on July 23, 2019, and is pending a Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) hearing for self-mutilation.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Identified as the cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein at the time of the suicide attempt incident on July 23, 2019.

connections.description: Were assigned as cellmates in the same prison unit at the time of the July 23, 2019 incident.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Attempt
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found with a homemade rope around his neck in his prison cell.

events.title: Administrative Status Update
events.description: Epstein's status is documented as pending a Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) hearing for a Code 228 violation (self-mutilation) related to the suicide attempt.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found with a homemade rope around his neck on July 23, 2019, in what is documented as a suicide attempt.
Epstein's cellmate at the time of the incident was Nicholas Tartaglione (Reg. No. 178514-054).
The Bureau of Prisons was pursuing a disciplinary hearing (DHO) against Epstein for a Code 228 violation (self-mutilation) related to the incident.
The document is part of a Threat Assessment case (NYM-19-0061) opened following the incident.
